title: Forces - Modified Atwood machine with two surfaces

content.description: Blocks <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are connected by a string that passes over a pulley with negligible mass and friction, as shown in the figure. Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is on a table covered with two different materials, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>. The two-block system is released from rest, and the speed of Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> begins to increase. When Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> reaches Material <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, its speed increases at a greater rate.
